forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 46. West northwest wind 5 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, a damp morning gives way to a day painted in shades of gray with the stark promise of rain lingering in the air. With the forecast stating a 90% chance of precipitation, expect the sky to unleash its bounty before the late afternoon, leaving behind a soft sheen on the streets. The day's high, sitting around 56 degrees, will gradually retreat into a cooler embrace as the afternoon unfolds, a reminder of the city’s ever-shifting temperament. With gusty winds from the west southwest, occasionally reaching as high as 28 mph, one might feel compelled to lean into the chill as they venture out.

As clouds dance overhead, the prospect of clearing skies brings a thread of hope, hinting at a partly sunny disposition later in the day. For those braving the morning, a layered approach to dressing is advisable; perhaps a sturdy raincoat, accompanied by a warm scarf, will do well against the brisk air and occasional bites of wind. As the light fades and temperatures drop to around 46 degrees, cozy indoor pursuits beckon. Strolling through local cafes or curling up with a good book inside a favorite nook could turn this gray day into a quiet alchemy of simple pleasures, wrapped in warmth and the gentle aroma of coffee drifting through the air, melding with the rhythm of the city.
